section.docs: Groups are a way to organize your documents. Contacts can be in any number of different groups. You can have multiple groups. Groups can also be extended with extra fields. They also group all the things associated with their contacts. You can use groups to generate specific sets of data for statistics.

section.title: Routes & Permissions
section.docs:
* `POST /groups`: All users * `GET /groups`: All users according to scoping * `GET /groups/:id`: All users according to scoping * `PUT /groups/:id`: The group manager or god * `DELETE /groups/:id`: The group manager or god
### Scoping
You can read groups you have access to. You get access these ways:
1. You are the group manager 2. You are following a group 3. The group is public 4. You are god

section.title: Format
section.docs:
Groups aggregate all data. They have fields. Refer to the fields section for more information. ### Changable Attributes
name
Required
email
A general contact email
phone
A general contact phone number
public
Name says it all
fields
Array of all the fields
contacts
IDs of all the contacts
user
ID of managing user
avatar
ID of managing user
### Read Only Attributes
todos
IDs of all the todos
deals
IDs of all the deals
messages
IDs of all the messages
notes
IDs of all the notes
phone_calls
IDs of all the phone call
meetings
IDs of all the meetings
campaigns
IDs for all the campaigns relating to contacts
users
IDs for all the users relating to contacts
activites
IDs for all the activities
Groups are automatically assigned to you.
